Core: Don't reset alpha to 1 if all red, green, blue & alpha provided

Before this commit the following code:

    jQuery.Color( { red: 10, green: 20, blue: 30, alpha: 0.4 } )

was incorrectly creating a Color object with the alpha property set to 1.

Fixes #58

* Build: Add dist/** to .eslintignore

* Build: Test on safari_previous instead of 8.0

Safari changed its versioning scheme; it now releases every version for last
three macOS versions; previously it used weird versioning where releases for
previous macOS versions kept the original major number and only updated the
minor; that's no longer the case.

Build: Add .npmrc with save-exact=true

This makes commands like `npm install package --save-dev` always get saved
to package.json as a pinned version and not as a `^`-delimited range.

Refs jquery/jquery#6600e2e2b9863dc91601d94541a3808cf3ccc90c

Build: Update package.json for compatibility with NPM modules

Closes GH-98

NPM and other package managers like JSPM expect to have a main
attribute in package.json to specify which file should be returned
when someone requires the library. [1]

It also specifies jQuery >= 1.11.0 as a peerDependency [2]. Older
versions of this package on npm are Node-only shims using contextify
from before we took ownership of the jquery package, they should not
be used and they will not "just work" with this plugin.

[1]: https://docs.npmjs.com/files/package.json#main
[2]: https://docs.npmjs.com/files/package.json#peerdependencies
